product.text:
Goofy and the Miller

Richly colored illustrations of castles and windmills add a fantastical flair to the underlying lesson of hard work, dedication, and always trying your best. Based on a children’s story from Denmark, Fedtmule og Mølleren der Ville Ha'en Hest, this fanciful tale features Goofy as one of three miller’s helpers. In preparation for retirement, the miller sets forth a challenge for his workers, vowing to give the mill to the helper who best demonstrates an understanding of his task. Goofy, the most industrious helper of all, reaps an unexpected reward and learns a valuable lesson on the merits of a job well done.

Tie-in Activity: Engage your child in a discussion regarding the importance of always trying his best. Cite examples of tasks in which he demonstrated his best efforts, such as picking up toys or helping with yard work, and then discuss how proud you felt when he tried his very best.
